events.originalText: A 20-year-old gunman shot twenty children and six adult staff members in a mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut.
events.subtitle: Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting
events.headline: Mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut

events.originalText: A 20-year-old gunman shot twenty children and six adult staff members in a mass shooting at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut.
events.subtitle: Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting
events.headline: Gunman shoots twenty children and six adults in Sandy Hook massacre

events.originalText: The tino rangatiratanga flag, representing the Māori people, was officially recognized by the government of New Zealand.
events.subtitle: Tino rangatiratanga
events.headline: Māori flag officially recognized by New Zealand government

events.originalText: During a press conference in Baghdad, Iraqi journalist Muntadhar al-Zaidi threw his shoes at U.S. president George W. Bush and Iraqi prime minister Nouri al-Maliki, yelling "This is for the widows and orphans and all those killed in Iraq".
events.subtitle: Baghdad
events.headline: Iraqi journalist throws shoes at George W. Bush in Baghdad

events.originalText: Torrential rains caused flash floods in the Venezuelan state of Vargas, resulting in tens of thousands of deaths, the destruction of thousands of homes, and the complete collapse of the state's infrastructure.
events.subtitle: Vargas tragedy
events.headline: Flash floods in Vargas, Venezuela lead to tens of thousands of deaths

events.originalText: Kosovo War: Yugoslav forces ambushed a group of Kosovo Liberation Army militants attempting to smuggle weapons into Yugoslavia from Albania.
events.subtitle: Kosovo War
events.headline: Yugoslav forces ambush Kosovo Liberation Army militants

events.originalText: War in Abkhazia: A helicopter carrying evacuees was shot down during the siege of Tkvarcheli, resulting in at least 52 deaths and catalysing more concerted Russian military intervention on behalf of Abkhazia.
events.subtitle: War in Abkhazia (1992–1993)
events.headline: Helicopter shot down during Abkhazia siege, 52 dead

events.originalText: The Knesset passed the Golan Heights Law, extending Israeli "laws, jurisdiction and administration" to the Golan Heights, effectively annexing the territory internationally recognized as part of Syria.
events.subtitle: Knesset
events.headline: Knesset passes Golan Heights Law annexing territory

events.originalText: Upon completing the third extra-vehicular activity of Apollo 17, American astronaut Gene Cernan became the last person to date to walk on the Moon.
events.subtitle: Extravehicular activity
events.headline: Gene Cernan becomes last person to walk on the Moon

events.originalText: The dam containing the Baldwin Hills Reservoir in Los Angeles failed, releasing a flood that killed five people and destroyed 277 homes.
events.subtitle: Baldwin Hills Dam disaster
events.headline: Baldwin Hills Reservoir dam failure kills five in Los Angeles

events.originalText: NASA's Mariner 2 became the world's first spacecraft to successfully conduct a planetary encounter when it flew by Venus.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: Mariner 2 conducts successful planetary encounter with Venus

events.originalText: Australian cricketer Ian Meckiff was run out on the last day of the first Test match between Australia and the West Indies, resulting in the first tied Test in cricket history.
events.subtitle: Ian Meckiff
events.headline: Ian Meckiff run out in first tied Test match in cricket history

events.originalText: American physicists Thomas T. Goldsmith Jr. and Estle Ray Mann were awarded a patent for their cathode-ray tube amusement device, the first interactive electronic game.
events.subtitle: Thomas T. Goldsmith Jr.
events.headline: Patent awarded for first interactive electronic game

events.originalText: The first British general election with female voters took place, with women over the age of thirty permitted to vote.
events.subtitle: 1918 United Kingdom general election
events.headline: First British general election with female voters takes place

events.originalText: Giacomo Puccini's comic opera Gianni Schicchi premiered at the Metropolitan Opera in New York City.
events.subtitle: Giacomo Puccini
events.headline: Giacomo Puccini's Gianni Schicchi premieres at Metropolitan Opera

events.originalText: Haruna (pictured), the fourth and last Japanese battlecruiser of the Kongō class, was launched and went on to serve in both world wars.
events.subtitle: Japanese battleship Haruna
events.headline: Japanese battlecruiser Haruna launched for service in world wars

events.originalText: Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen and his team became the first people to reach the South Pole.
events.subtitle: Roald Amundsen
events.headline: Roald Amundsen first to reach South Pole

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Battle of Bean's Station, the final battle of the Knoxville campaign, was fought in Grainger County, Tennessee.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Battle of Bean's Station fought in Tennessee during Civil War

events.originalText: The Toledo War, a mostly bloodless territorial dispute between Ohio and the Michigan Territory, was unofficially ended with a resolution passed by the controversial "Frostbitten Convention".
events.subtitle: Toledo War
events.headline: Toledo War unofficially ended with resolution at Frostbitten Convention

events.originalText: English domestic servant Anne Greene survived being hanged for infanticide.
events.subtitle: Anne Greene
events.headline: Anne Greene survives hanging for infanticide

events.originalText: In the Sweet Dew incident, Emperor Wenzong (pictured) of the Tang dynasty conspired to kill the powerful eunuchs of the Tang court, but the plot was foiled.
events.subtitle: Sweet Dew incident
events.headline: Emperor Wenzong's plot to kill eunuchs foiled in Sweet Dew incident
